title: Enhancing Smart Environments with Context-Aware Chatbots Using Large Language Models
author: Aurora Polo-Rodríguez (University of Granada), Laura Fiorini (University of Florence), Erika Rovini (University of Florence), Filippo Cavallo (University of Florence), Javier Medina-Quero (University of Granada)
relevance_why: The integration of Large Language Models (LLMs) with context-aware human activity recognition (HAR) can provide insights on improving audio generation frameworks by enhancing user interaction in smart environments.
background: Combining sensor data and language processing to create chatbots that can interact based on real-time user context within smart environments.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel architecture that integrates UWB-based localization and HAR to empower chatbots for context-aware assistance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods lacked real-time adaptability and context integration, relying on predefined responses.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by dynamically incorporating real-time user activity and location data into the chatbot’s interactions, allowing for proactive and personalized user experiences.

key_innovation: The distinct integration of HAR with LLMs enables chatbots to tailor interactions based on immediate user context, enhancing engagement and user satisfaction.
real_world_impact: The proposed system has the potential to significantly improve the quality of life for elderly individuals living independently, providing necessary assistance and companionship through natural language interaction.
limitations: The paper does not specify any limitations.

new_terms.UWB: **Ultrawide Band** is a radio technology that can transmit data over a wide frequency range, allowing for precise location tracking and distance measurements.
new_terms.HAR: **Human Activity Recognition** refers to the ability to identify specific actions or behaviors of individuals through data collected from various sensors.
